# kfbmisc

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

`kfbmisc` is a package full of utility function I find useful

## Installation

You can install the development version of kfbmisc from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("kylebutts/kfbmisc")
```

## Utilities

```{r}
library(kfbmisc)
```

### `ggplot2` theme

This is a relatively simple theme that makes the font larger for figures and adds more margins around things. 

```{r}
#| fig.width: 8
#| fig.height: 5
library(ggplot2)
library(palmerpenguins)

(p = ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_point(aes(x = body_mass_g, y = bill_length_mm)) +
  labs(
    x = "Body mass", y = "Bill length"
  ) +
  theme_kyle(base_size = 14))
```

```{r}
#| fig.width: 8
#| fig.height: 5
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_point(aes(x = body_mass_g, y = bill_length_mm)) +
  facet_wrap(~ species) +
  labs(
    x = "Body mass", y = "Bill length"
  ) +
  theme_kyle(base_size = 14)
```

```{r}
#| fig.width: 8
#| fig.height: 5
library(sf)
nc <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf"))

ggplot(nc) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = BIR74)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c() + 
  theme_kyle(base_size = 14) + 
  theme_map()
```

### `tikzsave`

```{r}
# `plot` -> `tikzpicture` -> `pdf`
tikzsave(
  "man/figures/README-penguins.tex",
  p, width = 8, height = 5
)
knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/README-penguins.pdf")
```


### `gt` theme

This theme borrow heavily from [Thomas Mock](https://themockup.blog/posts/2020-09-26-functions-and-themes-for-gt-tables/)

```{r}
#| results: asis
library(gt)

mtcars[1:5, ] |>
  gt() |>
  gt_theme_kyle() |>
  tab_header(title = make_gt_title("mtcars Dataset")) |>
  tab_source_note(source_note = "Data from mtcars in R") |>
  as_raw_html()
```
